content.description: The pesticide DDT was widely used in the 1940s as a method of insect control. In the late 1950s the first DDT-resistant mosquitoes were discovered, and eventually DDT-resistant mosquitoes were found globally. When DDT is used now, the development of DDT resistance in mosquito populations occurs in months rather than years.
content.question: Which of the following best explains the observations concerning DDT resistance in mosquitoes?

choices.label: Competition for limited resources causes mosquitoes to migrate to geographical areas that have richer supplies of DDT.
The proportion of DDT-resistant mosquitoes in a population remains constant due to the metabolic costs of DDT utilization
Natural selection favors DDT-resistant mosquitoes that are already present in a population when DDT exposure occurs.
DDT is a chemical signal that delays normal reproductive cycles in many mosquito populations.

content.answer: Natural selection favors DDT-resistant mosquitoes that are already present in a population when DDT exposure occurs.
